section.name: Download SOD
section.p: SOD is distributed as either a tar file or a zip file. Both contain identical content, so you only need to download the one that is most convenient for you. See the INSTALL document for an explanation of the contents.
Current Release: Sod 2.0 RC1 TAR ZIP

ul.li: ETOPO information on map
Detail in strategy file documentation
removeDatabase property works properly
Several new editor widgets
Several bug fixes
Safeguards for minor hiccups from the event server
Safeguards for minor hiccups from the seismogram server
New strategy file reference
Table sorting works in Safari
Various improvements were made to the layout of the status pages.
Loading and saving files in the editor now correctly respects the location given to it.
New legacy execution processor
New linear distance from a point magnitude subsetter
Improvements were made to the robustness of the connection to the network server.
SOD's sh scripts work on Solaris now.
Save now works on config files loaded automatically by the editor.
Links to the config file and its HTML version are now correct in the menus.
This was a minor bug fix release.
SOD now uses the at most once/at least once property to determine if it should reopen or permanently close event channel pairs that were being processed when a run died.
Seismograms displayed after running through the response gain processor are now correctly labelled and scaled.

This release marks the introduction of the motion vector channel grouper. Instead of just grouping channels on their orientation codes, SOD can use a series of rules to determine which channels go together in the motion vector arm.
DSML file output is vastly improved. It requires 10 times less memory and is twice as fast!
There is a new postEventWait event subsetter. Check out these realtime considerations to see how it works.
SOD will no longer retry event channel pairs until the end of time.
SOD will warn you if you're running a new version of SOD on an old database and if you've changed config files between runs on a single database.
There is a new removeEventDuplicate subsetter that will keep SOD from processing duplicate event entries.
-demo flag starts SOD on tutorial.xml
An HTML version of the config file is created by the status system.
HTML view of waveforms sorted by stations
All columns in the tables can be sorted
Can now query the DMC's archive
There are none. This is the first beta.
